intro: Leptochilus crenatus var. genuinus, commonly known as the smooth-leaved water starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and narrow, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color and bloom during the summer months. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and morphological features.
